label: HTML5
description: HTML5 is a markup language used for structuring and presenting content on the Web. It is the fifth and last major HTML version that is a World Wide Web Consortium recommendation.

label: CSS3
description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a language that is used to illustrate the look, style, and format of a document written in any markup language. CSS3 is the latest version of an earlier CSS version, CSS2.

label: VS Code
description: Visual Studio Code is a code editor made by Microsoft. Features include support for debugging, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, code refactoring, and embedded Git.

label: Vue.js
description: A progressive JS framework for building user interfaces. Designed to be incrementally adoptable. It combines some excellent ideas from Angular and React into an easy-to-use package.

label: Git
description: Git is software for tracking changes in any set of files, usually used for coordinating work among programmers collaboratively developing source code during software development.

label: Sass
description: Sass is a preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into CSS. It consists of 'the indented syntax' similar to Haml and the newer syntax 'SCSS' (Sassy CSS) with block formatting.

label: TypeScript
description: A programming language developed and maintained by Microsoft. It is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript and adds optional static typing to the language.

label: JavaScript
description: A programming language that conforms to ECMAScript and one of the core web-technologies. It is high-level, JIT-compiled with dynamic typing and first-class functions.

label: Bitbucket
description: Bitbucket is a Git-based source code repository hosting service owned by Atlassian. It offers both commercial plans and free accounts with an unlimited number of private repositories.

label: .NET Core
description: A cross-platform .NET implementation for websites, servers, and console apps. It supports C# and TypeScript and offers extensive class libraries, common APIs and tools.

label: C#
description: A programming language developed by Microsoft that runs on the .NET Framework, used to develop games, web, desktop, mobile apps and more. One of the top 5 languages used by projects on GitHub.

label: GitHub
description: A provider of Internet hosting for software development that offers the distributed version control and source code management functionality of Git, plus its own features.

label: React
description: An open-source, front end, JS library maintained by Facebook, used for building user interfaces or UI components. It can serve as a base in the development of single-page or mobile applications.
